channel.title: Credit Risk on Intricate Mechanisms
channel.description: Recent content in Credit Risk on Intricate Mechanisms

item.title: Minding your Ps and Qs
item.description: I have a lot of respect for the UK actuarial exams, and in some ways that respect has actually increased since I gave up on them a few years back. Broadly speaking: the earlier actuarial exams get you up to speed with a bunch of essential technical topics, whilst the later exams teach you how to apply those topics without falling into any of a few hundred known pitfalls. Using one highly regarded framework for skills analysis, the earlier exams can be viewed as buffing your INT score, with the later exams focusing on WIS.
